trans-unit.source: User-defined schemas in SQL Data Warehouse | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: User-defined schemas in SQL Data Warehouse | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Tips for using Transact-SQL schemas in Azure SQL Data Warehouse for developing solutions.
trans-unit.target: Tips for using Transact-SQL schemas in Azure SQL Data Warehouse for developing solutions.

trans-unit.source: Traditional data warehouses often use separate databases to create application boundaries based on either workload, domain or security.
trans-unit.target: Traditional data warehouses often use separate databases to create application boundaries based on either workload, domain or security.

trans-unit.source: For example, a traditional SQL Server data warehouse might include a staging database, a data warehouse database, and some data mart databases.
trans-unit.target: For example, a traditional SQL Server data warehouse might include a staging database, a data warehouse database, and some data mart databases.

trans-unit.source: In this topology each database operates as a workload and security boundary in the architecture.
trans-unit.target: In this topology each database operates as a workload and security boundary in the architecture.

trans-unit.source: By contrast, SQL Data Warehouse runs the entire data warehouse workload within one database.
trans-unit.target: By contrast, SQL Data Warehouse runs the entire data warehouse workload within one database.

trans-unit.source: Cross database joins are not permitted.
trans-unit.target: Cross database joins are not permitted.

trans-unit.source: Therefore SQL Data Warehouse expects all tables used by the warehouse to be stored within the one database.
trans-unit.target: Therefore SQL Data Warehouse expects all tables used by the warehouse to be stored within the one database.

trans-unit.source: SQL Data Warehouse does not support cross database queries of any kind.
trans-unit.target: SQL Data Warehouse does not support cross database queries of any kind.

trans-unit.source: Consequently, data warehouse implementations that leverage this pattern will need to be revised.
trans-unit.target: Consequently, data warehouse implementations that leverage this pattern will need to be revised.

trans-unit.source: These are recommendations for consolidating workloads, security, domain and functional boundaries by using user defined schemas
trans-unit.target: These are recommendations for consolidating workloads, security, domain and functional boundaries by using user defined schemas

trans-unit.source: Use one SQL Data Warehouse database to run your entire data warehouse workload
trans-unit.target: Use one SQL Data Warehouse database to run your entire data warehouse workload

trans-unit.source: Consolidate your existing data warehouse environment to use one SQL Data Warehouse database
trans-unit.target: Consolidate your existing data warehouse environment to use one SQL Data Warehouse database

trans-unit.source: Leverage user-defined schemas to provide the boundary previously implemented using databases.
trans-unit.target: Leverage user-defined schemas to provide the boundary previously implemented using databases.

trans-unit.source: If user-defined schemas have not been used previously then you have a clean slate.
trans-unit.target: If user-defined schemas have not been used previously then you have a clean slate.

trans-unit.source: Simply use the old database name as the basis for your user-defined schemas in the SQL Data Warehouse database.
trans-unit.target: Simply use the old database name as the basis for your user-defined schemas in the SQL Data Warehouse database.

trans-unit.source: If schemas have already been used then you have a few options:
trans-unit.target: If schemas have already been used then you have a few options:

trans-unit.source: Remove the legacy schema names and start fresh
trans-unit.target: Remove the legacy schema names and start fresh

trans-unit.source: Retain the legacy schema names by pre-pending the legacy schema name to the table name
trans-unit.target: Retain the legacy schema names by pre-pending the legacy schema name to the table name

trans-unit.source: Retain the legacy schema names by implementing views over the table in an extra schema to re-create the old schema structure.
trans-unit.target: Retain the legacy schema names by implementing views over the table in an extra schema to re-create the old schema structure.

trans-unit.source: On first inspection option 3 may seem like the most appealing option.
trans-unit.target: On first inspection option 3 may seem like the most appealing option.

trans-unit.source: However, the devil is in the detail.
trans-unit.target: However, the devil is in the detail.

trans-unit.source: Views are read only in SQL Data Warehouse.
trans-unit.target: Views are read only in SQL Data Warehouse.

trans-unit.source: Any data or table modification would need to be performed against the base table.
trans-unit.target: Any data or table modification would need to be performed against the base table.

trans-unit.source: Option 3 also introduces a layer of views into your system.
trans-unit.target: Option 3 also introduces a layer of views into your system.

trans-unit.source: You might want to give this some additional thought if you are using views in your architecture already.
trans-unit.target: You might want to give this some additional thought if you are using views in your architecture already.

trans-unit.source: Implement user-defined schemas based on database names
trans-unit.target: Implement user-defined schemas based on database names

trans-unit.source: Retain legacy schema names by pre-pending them to the table name.
trans-unit.target: Retain legacy schema names by pre-pending them to the table name.

trans-unit.source: Use schemas for the workload boundary.
trans-unit.target: Use schemas for the workload boundary.

trans-unit.source: Retain legacy schema names using views
trans-unit.target: Retain legacy schema names using views

trans-unit.source: Any change in schema strategy needs a review of the security model for the database.
trans-unit.target: Any change in schema strategy needs a review of the security model for the database.

trans-unit.source: In many cases you might be able to simplify the security model by assigning permissions at the schema level.
trans-unit.target: In many cases you might be able to simplify the security model by assigning permissions at the schema level.

trans-unit.source: If more granular permissions are required then you can use database roles.
trans-unit.target: If more granular permissions are required then you can use database roles.

trans-unit.source: For more development tips, see <linkText>development overview</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more development tips, see <linkText>development overview</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: sql-data-warehouse-overview-develop.md
trans-unit.target: sql-data-warehouse-overview-develop.md
